metadata.title: CVE-2019-5094 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the quota filefunctionality of E2fsprogs 1.45.3. A specially crafted ext4 partition cancause an out-of-bounds write on the heap, resulting in code execution. Anattacker can corrupt a partition to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

e2fsck-static - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
e2fslibs - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
e2fsprogs - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
e2fsprogs-l10n - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
fuse2fs - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
libcom-err2 - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
libcomerr2 - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
libext2fs2 - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
libss2 - 1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: e2fsprogs package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.44.1-1ubuntu1.2').
